D45A9E891716457E908AD3A2A0EB7E03.description: maintain an up-to-date portfolio that includes pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in construction technology (e.g., Passport to Safety certificate, technical drawings, reports, photographs of projects, Ontario Skills Passport Work Plan and Transition Plan), and explain why having a current portfolio is important for career development and advancement.

05527D35AA85469AB26EFE40D1C0AF2B.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the work habits that are important for success in the construction industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., working safely, teamwork, initiative);

0D2092732D1643C29382140DAF6377C5.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the Essential Skills that are important for success in the construction industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., computer use, data analysis, measurement and calculation);

6A8BA510206047A586480724C390CFA2.description: explain the importance of lifelong learning for careers in the construction industry;

98DAC8439BE945099058ACEA99AA4A8F.description: describe a variety of careers in the construction industry (e.g., contractor, architect, engineer, tradesperson, technician, technologist, labourer, project manager), and identify relevant postsecondary programs and their admission requirements;

7E92B4AD63FE4D499F24EA928F4E659C.description: Career Opportunities: demonstrate an understanding of careers in the construction industry and the education, training, and workplace skills required for these careers.

5CB79F290D1E49998F0DB3FE24CE751F.description: demonstrate the understanding of when and how to use appropriate protective clothing, gear, and equipment (e.g., hard hat, respirator, safety harness)

A0B4D470635D4CB5B7598835F8C25AB9.description: describe the rights and responsibilities of employees (e.g., the right to know, the right to refuse, the right to participate, as outlined in the Occupational Health and Safety Act);

1AA591B8F8AB48BBBD376E18C11C835B.description: use, handle, and store materials in accordance with Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) guidelines;

C65461CDAD6B47489FC2208C61A4E8E2.description: describe and comply with health and safety legislation and practices for the construction industry (e.g., Workplace Safety and Insurance Board [WSIB] regulations, provincial labour legislation, local by-laws);

654A4761976C4A54A3B03C2E004B2C95.description: assess hazards related to construction materials, processes, tools, and equipment (e.g., toxic or flammable fumes from solvents, paints, varnishes, and gasoline; explosion or burns from propane; lung damage from silica; tripping or falls in unfinished buildings; shock from damaged power tools or electrical equipment), and describe the precautions that should be taken to avoid these hazards;

3F4715E4350248B6B3EEF59719306FD5.description: Health and Safety: demonstrate an understanding of and comply with health and safety regulations and practices specific to the construction industry;

97008BA6C62A4B0791082C6C838A9E22.description: identify factors to consider in community planning (e.g., population density, ecology, culture).

C139F63F94D6412CAACB3ECF8F91CE03.description: describe how provincial and municipal regulations affect the design and cost of construction projects and influence how the construction industry meets societal needs;

E844DAE37A6B479BA3F1D8C17F271A37.description: describe the factors affecting the quality of life of the occupants of residential and/or light commercial buildings (e.g., air quality, allergens, carcinogens, aesthetics, access to transit and other services);

B16BF1A5BEA64572A6C4A134DFDD36F9.description: research and assess the economic and social effects of the construction industry (e.g., creation of primary and secondary jobs, transport of materials, land use, resource management, encroachment on Aboriginal lands);

1629653DA74243DC86EBB690B3BF4795.description: Technology and Society: explain how the construction industry and society affect each other.

391F0BEA14264A3CA138A7A0ED3888F4.description: research and describe strategies for implementing sustainable building practices (e.g., Canada Green Building Council guidelines, Forest Stewardship Council Canada standards).

35BFDF6737614324BF504E778965A84B.description: outline strategies to reduce, reuse, and recycle construction materials, and identify methods for implementing sustainable building practices (e.g., work with a community partner or government agency, help develop local programs, create a public awareness campaign);

574B820A694C42ED8C72891497826B5B.description: compare ways of reducing the environmental footprint of construction projects through the choice of energy sources (e.g., solar, geothermal, wind), building design (e.g., extra insulation, highefficiency heating systems, green roof), and construction processes (e.g., use of recycled material, fuel-efficient equipment);

D45D9444E0104AD1B207CB449A38F03A.description: describe the costs and benefits of environmentally friendly building practices (e.g., highefficiency heating and cooling, renewable energy technologies, reuse of grey water, use of materials produced from sustainable resources);

F54686098CD0498C88075FBAAC758373.description: plan projects and construction processes to minimize waste (e.g., use efficient cutting patterns, reuse leftover material);

E79EFEC6967647888F272A39ABCCC167.description: Technology and the Environment: identify and evaluate measures that can be taken to conserve resources on construction projects;

B0EE418664AF4073B958061DFC8D7034.description: apply appropriate interior materials to finish residential and light commercial construction projects (e.g., baseboard, wainscoting, crown moulding, interior doors, hardware, built-ins).

52543C2459934E40A3E3FB6B63074DFA.description: apply appropriate exterior materials to finish residential and light commercial construction projects (e.g., siding, brick, stone, exterior doors, windows, metal roofing);

68431A3D83AB47F9AA8681C4CFF82B44.description: Finishing: apply various finishes to complete residential and light commercial construction projects.

2391546EB0F64D86A086277CA52C2E83.description: describe and implement appropriate solutions and/or modifications in response to problems encountered in residential and light commercial construction projects.

9FE4650ABD6546B4B0BC2649A7A6CBD2.description: safely install various systems of a construction project (e.g., electrical, plumbing, heating/ventilation/ air-conditioning) in accordance with codes, regulations, and standards (e.g., Ontario Building Code requirements for joists and beams);

04A4C8E4E11A439396B00036F81029B4.description: construct projects in accordance with design specifications (e.g., working drawings, lists of specified materials and fixtures);

36B54F4D752647AD9321868B9C085470.description: Fabrication and Assembly: demonstrate safe and accurate building techniques;

367258C9360E4E298530A54DC87094AA.description: lay out construction projects using a variety of tools and equipment (e.g., framing square, laser level, string line, plumb bob).

7C9D4B48A1A54817B8B1B791C3DDDD60.description: use metric and imperial units correctly to measure and specify materials and components for a variety of construction projects;

F3D8D0297152415094415FC2377051D0.description: demonstrate safe work practices when using hand and power tools, materials, and equipment;

6EC56C5C83274953AA00CF8CCA93E51B.description: Technical Skills: demonstrate appropriate technical skills, including the safe use of construction tools, equipment, and materials

6E7B2A06A075470BBDA86098BB5F9EC8.description: prepare detailed, accurate estimates of the quantities and costs of materials required for construction projects (e.g., concrete, aggregate, reinforcing steel, asphalt, lumber, roofing, interior and exterior finishes).

AD3C345858CE4BC7AB404B3A2C5C0B72.description: use the tables in Part 9 of the Ontario Building Code to determine the required sizes, spacing, and number of structural components for construction projects (e.g., footings, floor joists, wall studs, rafters, beams, columns);

2602238E83C14F8A8AC6695990A24312.description: convert between fractions and decimals and between metric and imperial units, using appropriate tables, charts, software, and/or online conversion tools;

F25C36F3BDD044F79E56F0AE123A7FDB.description: calculate dimensions and lay out construction projects using relevant mathematical principles and formulas (e.g., Pythagorean theorem, volume and area formulas);

9713B552033C47038809443FC1A19C36.description: Mathematical Skills: apply the mathematical skills required in designing, laying out, and preparing estimates for residential and light commercial construction projects.

F1FADD5665BA44B3B9258C6380E054CF.description: identify and compare modifications (e.g., upgraded ventilation, insulation, or air barriers) that would improve the quality and value of a building project (e.g., resale value, cost recovery).

29146B699F23431ABD46C62A556C71A4.description: plan the installation of the systems used in typical residential and/or light commercial buildings (e.g., foundation, framing, electrical, plumbing, heating/ventilation/air-conditioning);

D80CEBA510B448F5AA9F69A69D30B827.description: develop plans for a foundation suitable for the site conditions and building design (e.g., site conditions: hydrostatic pressure, drainage, soils, frost penetration; design: type of framing and exterior wall finishes);

5CB0E9B3FA8B4AFCB93BD57F3FE9AEA5.description: Building Systems: plan systems for residential and/or light commercial buildings;

7A0C8D5281D64F39BF4C8681C9E72C70.description: communicate accurate technical information verbally and graphically

982C6A32F94F411AB0B9ADF4848FB57B.description: describe the building code requirements for forces and stresses due to loads and weather conditions (e.g., heat, cold, wind, snow, rain) that structural members (e.g., footings, foundations, floors, bearing walls, roofs, columns, beams, lintels) must be designed to withstand;

76C5755F7C1448A48C675D00C0C34A04.description: use various resources to determine technical data, code requirements, and standards for construction projects (e.g., reference charts and tables; reports; published codes, regulations, and standards; guides and trade manuals; manufacturers’ instructions; government and association websites);

4E74563C2DB140A7B980829460D216DE.description: Using Technical Data: determine, use, and communicate accurate technical data for construction projects;

D1A92874D82A49A4BD6A3524C38703FF.description: create at least one working drawing of a building system (e.g., structural, electrical, plumbing, heating/ventilation/air-conditioning) with manual and/or computer-assisted methods, using appropriate views (e.g., orthographic, plan, elevation, isometric, 3D, section, detail) and metric and/or imperial units.

D0841F02E0374F269C735EB65503135A.description: interpret technical drawings to accurately plan and lay out residential and light commercial construction projects (e.g., determine dimensions, materials required, hardware placement, window and door sizes and types, and location of electrical and plumbing fixtures);

E6FDDD7A74394DF7B07CF4EBCCDA8987.description: Technical Drawings: create and interpret drawings of residential and light commercial construction projects;

B4887E1095D74B7EAD1A8D276825405A.description: apply design principles and elements to the design of construction projects (e.g., principles: scale, proportion, balance, contrast; elements: shape, space, line, texture, colour).

DF5F84400BF442A9BFE602FBC522D84F.description: apply technological concepts (e.g., aesthetics, ergonomics, function) to the design of construction projects (e.g., shape of staircases, appearance of facades, layout of floors, placement of electrical and plumbing fixtures);

79091B5B392A4767811B5CA5FCEEE60D.description: use appropriate problem-solving processes and techniques to address challenges related to various residential and light commercial construction projects;

2F50B712B4BB4518A50FE7ED5F142794.description: explain how the design process is used in the construction industry (e.g., developing floor plans, designing prefabricated buildings; in urban planning);

270199A701AB4BBFA083E90C39AB62CF.description: Design and Planning: apply a design process, other problem-solving techniques, and related concepts and principles, as appropriate, to plan construction projects and develop solutions for construction problems and challenges;

885BC76D22034F54A19773BF5EDB0CD3.description: use correct terminology to identify and describe the documents used for planning, scheduling, and controlling the construction process (e.g., schedules, contracts, Gantt charts, permits, sub-trade contracts).

135CFADBB8D94957A3B67EC84B79B41F.description: use correct terminology to identify and describe construction tools and equipment (e.g., air compressor, laser level, backhoe, framing hammer, wire stripper, tri-square);

BCBA6975F21D49D9B5BF77AF34B47A50.description: use correct terminology to identify and describe construction processes and concepts (e.g., processes: dress, rip, crosscut, joint; concepts: slope, load, thermal resistance, stability, compression strength);

B6E7F3AE7BB741C3AFC56F5CA2252B1B.description: use correct terminology to identify and describe construction components and materials (e.g., stud, girder, ground-fault circuit interrupter, P-trap, plenum, conduit, armoured cable)

EBCCFF246A1F45F382A72E8CC192A44B.description: compare various building types (e.g. residential, light commercial), architectural styles (e.g., Colonial, Tudor, Victorian, Aboriginal), and their engineering features (e.g., engineered floor joists, exposed roof trusses, steel beams, fire barriers).

557143BC792E49EB8BECE7072013F1C4.description: describe the weather-related loads and stresses that a building must be designed to withstand (e.g., force of wind, snow load on roofs, expansion and contraction due to changes in temperature and humidity);

B3D010A5E64E4328925545CDFC9327BE.description: describe factors affecting the design of a foundation (e.g., drainage, soil type, load, frost penetration);

3CF1CA1566984E93A8A1E2F4F39A85B7.description: explain the reasons for selecting a particular structure and materials for a construction project (e.g., structure: wood versus steel beams; materials: asphalt or cedar shingles versus steel roofing, siding versus brick);

40C1F51BABF64A56B1020940CF03C02A.description: assess the human factors (e.g., function, ergonomics, aesthetics) to consider when planning aspects of a building (e.g., size, appearance, traffic flow, means of egress, use of non-allergenic materials);

8456AD4B00024199B35AFA18F9573989.description: Design Considerations: demonstrate an understanding of design considerations for residential and light commercial buildings;

ABE7DC0D01E94718B41CE3D8266AC27A.description: describe heating and cooling systems in typical residential and light commercial buildings (e.g., forced-air furnace, hot-water boiler, ducts, electrical heating, air conditioning), and outline the requirements of the Ontario Building Code (Part 6) that apply to these systems.

C091D96DA54A4FB6B5BB247403A0A147.description: describe the components of plumbing systems of typical residential and light commercial buildings (e.g., water supply, piping, fixtures, sewer or septic tank connection), and outline the requirements of the Ontario Building Code (Parts 7 and 8) that apply to these systems

84B25B115202463AAF3FF5042C71F315.description: describe the components of electrical systems of typical residential and light commercial buildings (e.g., service, circuit-breaker panels, wiring, fixtures), and outline the requirements of the Ontario Electrical Safety Code that apply to these systems;

19A711300552499896ADDE18059EF79F.description: describe the structural systems of typical residential and light commercial buildings, and outline the requirements of the Ontario Building Code that apply to these systems;

EE940C26AE2C475898C79B3965754D82.description: describe the foundations of typical residential and light commercial buildings, and outline the requirements of the Ontario Building Code that apply to these foundations;

D3D0B4CF774A45F597717B0F876A4645.description: Building Systems: demonstrate an understanding of the systems in residential and light commercial buildings

2CA81DEDFE4543A0B83D4233E71608B1.description: describe standards for sustainable building practices (e.g., Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design [LEED®] certification standards).

871455D38A374509B9FAEB293325DA79.description: identify and describe the standards that apply to residential and light commercial construction projects (e.g., standards from the Workplace Safety and Insurance Board [WSIB], the Canadian Standards Association [CSA], and Underwriters Laboratories of Canada [ULC]);

F50E3B319BDA46F8985C6A75D84BC4F1.description: identify permits and inspections required for residential and light commercial construction projects (e.g., building, plumbing, electrical);

CE845FF1638344888521C437937BB13F.description: identify the authorities that regulate residential and light commercial construction (e.g., municipalities, conservation authorities), and explain the pertinent regulations (e.g., requirements for setbacks, easements, and barrier-free access);

755DD0C728A54362B913349EEB083CCE.description: identify and explain the building codes that apply to residential and light commercial construction (e.g., Ontario Building Code, Ontario Electrical Safety Code, Ontario Fire Code);

8AC25C719C824256AF50B6F41689A899.description: Building Codes, Regulations, and Standards: demonstrate an understanding of building codes, regulations, and standards that govern residential and light commercial construction projects;

47F2936396BD4902A430DAA21BD6F767.description: describe the relationship between structural and architectural components in a building (e.g., cladding on a support pier, material concealing a steel beam)

984988F13DB248D99446A5C7AD668EE9.description: assess various types of structural and nonstructural components of a building (e.g., structural: floors, studs, trusses, rafters, engineered floor joists, laminated beams; non-structural: trim, stiles, cabinetry, curtain walls, siding);

148FAB1C7CCC4FC284A759999E008576.description: compare the processes for constructing common types of foundations and structural supports for a building (e.g., slip forming, insulated concrete forming, post and beam, platform framing, balloon framing);

270255655280409381FF304F3DA14862.description: describe the various processes used to produce common construction materials and components (e.g., concrete and masonry products, engineered wood products, doors, windows, trusses);

A40A7D260E984B8D91C6BD1AB04E14D5.description: compare different building materials and techniques that can be used for the same purpose (e.g., cement block versus poured concrete for a foundation, wood versus steel doors, digging a trench versus using a pneumatic torpedo to install a water service, nails versus adhesive for attaching panelling);

A7D387EC9E414AF98A4B1AF3533A3EE5.description: assess the properties (e.g., physical, mechanical, thermal) of various natural and manufactured building materials (e.g., wood studs, steel studs, laminated beams, engineered floor joists);

1EDE7A15A3184A71AD3B959D5B20E09C.description: Materials, Processes, and Components: demonstrate an understanding of natural and manufactured materials, construction processes, and building components
